description: Latin advertent-, advertens, present participle of advertere, from the verb adverto (“I give or draw attention to”)

adjectives.description: advertent (comparative more advertent, superlative most advertent)

examples: Is he rich, prosperous, great? yet he continues safe, because he continues humble, watchful, advertent, lest he should be deceived and transported
There is such thing as advertent negligence in which the harm is foreseen as possible or probable.
